page.title: 06KINLOCH CASTLE,RHUM_INTRO.
page.content:
Kinloch Castle is situated at the head of Loch Scresort. It took 5 years to build & was finished in 1902 at an estimated cost of Â£250,000. It is a square building with turrets and a high tower over the main entrance. Sandstone, cut & shaped on Arran, was used. Sir George Bullough, the owner, a Lancashire man, brought the builders with him.
There is a glass covered walk_way round the outside, and a large conservatoy was build on the south side where all kinds of plants were grown & exotic caged birds were kept. It is not a castle in the true sense but a large mansion built as a holiday home.
The Castle is now run as a hotel by the Nature Conservancy Council.
